column4: Hello guys, I am trying to setup a cron job (for the first time in my life), but nothing seems to happen......This is my crontab entry   21      12      *       *       *       /home/raghavan/ngodost/script/run.sh > /home/raghavan/out. Nothing gets written into the out file....and all I am doing is echoing some text. please help me in debugging things with this
21 12 * * * sh /home/raghavan/ngodost/script/run.sh > /home/raghavan/out
No luck :-( ! I tried doing a cd to the directory of the script and then execute the shell file....but nothing got written into the out file.
Can you apste the command you are using?
31 12 * * * (cd /home/raghavan/ngodost/script; ./run.sh > /home/raghavan/out)
Try: 31 12 * * * cd /home/raghavan/ngodost/script && ./run.sh > /home/raghavan/out
ok
Are you sure the script itself is written correctly?
It has nothing but an echo statement and works properly when I run from the shell. After making the changes suggested by you just now, but no luck.....
Is the script executable?
-rwxr-xr-x 1 raghavan raghavan 64 2007-03-27 11:05 run.sh (permissions of the script file)
Ah, ok. Then I have no idea why it isn't working. You are saving the cronjob, right?
I have added the entry using crontab -e command and when I do crontab -l, the command is in the crontab file. Do you think I am missing anything?
No, that's correct.
How do I redirect the errors that cron job spits out into some file?
Does 'ps aux | grep cron' give you more than one line of return?
You only get a line that ends in grep crond ?
yeah.....only the grep process gets listed
Sounds like cron isn't even running

But when I boot my system I can see lot of cron process running......I have no knowledge about the behaviour of cron except that it can execute schedule jobs in background. So, what's my next step then?
Thanks... I got it working after I started the cron scheduler
Ah, thought so.
